title: Under the Surface
description: I'm drowning.I want to swim to the surface. I try to swim to the surface, but my body just won’t move. I sink. I panic. I think—this is the moment I will finally drown. Emilie Waters has been on her own since moving out of an abusive home at the age of eighteen. Now twenty-one, she is attending a new college in Rhode Island where she struggles to make a new life for herself. Spending her days going to class and nights working at a local diner. It’s there that she meets student and photographer, Ren Warren, who’s drawn to Emilie after taking her photo. For Ren, he’s always believed you can tell a lot about a person through their picture. But when it comes to Emilie, there’s so much left to be known. He wants to learn more about her past—what causes that look of sadness on her face when she thinks no one is watching. And he becomes determined to be the one to fix it.But when the pain of Emilie’s past becomes too much for her to bear, will Ren be strong enough to pull her out of it? Or will Emilie be left to drown?83,000 words. A New Adult Romance, first in a series of interconnected characters. Each book can be read as a standalone. Due to mature content recommended for readers 18+
author: K.P. Renee
